newsitem.title: USA: Missouri corn crop 76 percent mature, soy 8 pct.
newsitem.headline: Missouri corn crop 76 percent mature, soy 8 pct.

text.p: Missouri's corn crop was 76 percent mature and the soybean crop was eight percent mature as of Sunday, according to the Missouri Agricultural Statistics Service.

The corn crop maturity was ahead of 46 percent a year ago and 68 percent average. Corn conditions were one percent very poor, seven percent poor, 26 percent fair, 48 percent good and 18 percent excellent.
Fifty-two percent of soybeans were turning color, with 24 percent dropping leaves. Development of the soybean crop was about three days ahead of last year but about five days behind average.
Soybean conditions were two percent very poor, nine percent poor, 36 percent fair, 43 percent good and 10 percent excellent.

Eighty percent of the cotton crop was opening bolls, eight days ahead of last year's average of 65 percent and about 10 days ahead of the average pace. Cotton was rated seven percent poor, 25 percent fair, 58 good and 10 percent excellent.
Four percent of winter wheat had been seeded, the same as a year ago but behind the average pace of six percent.
